---
title: "Troubleshooting"
---

This page is a grab-bag of quick fixes and diagnostic commands for the tools used in this course.

---

## Quarto isn’t found / Render button doesn’t work for `.qmd`

**Fix:**
1. Install Quarto: https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/  
2. Restart RStudio.  
3. Verify:
   ```bash
   quarto check
   quarto --version
````

---

## PDF render fails (“No TeX installation detected”, missing LaTeX package)

**Fix (fastest):**

```bash
quarto install tinytex
```

Optionally verify from R:

```r
if (requireNamespace("tinytex", quietly = TRUE)) tinytex::is_tinytex()
```

---

## Quarto tries to render the whole repo

Limit rendering to the website files with a whitelist in `site/_quarto.yml`:

```yaml
project:
  type: website
  output-dir: _site
  render:
    - index.qmd
    - pages/**/*.qmd
```

---

## “Files didn’t appear” after running package commands

* Confirm you’re inside your course **Project**, then:

  ```r
  getwd()
  ```
* Refresh the **Files** pane or click into the expected folder.
* Re-run the command and check messages/errors.

---

## RStudio doesn’t show the **Git** tab

Enable Git for the Project:
**Tools → Project Options → Git/SVN** (or create the Project from Version Control).

Verify Git is on your PATH:

```bash
git --version
```

---

## Git push fails (password prompts, auth errors)

Use **HTTPS + Personal Access Token (PAT)** or **SSH**.

* PAT: create a token and use it when Git asks for a password. Install Git Credential Manager to cache it.
  Token docs: [https://docs.github.com/authentication/keeping-your-account-and-data-secure/creating-a-personal-access-token](https://docs.github.com/authentication/keeping-your-account-and-data-secure/creating-a-personal-access-token)
  GCM: [https://github.com/GitCredentialManager/git-credential-manager](https://github.com/GitCredentialManager/git-credential-manager)

* SSH: add your public key in GitHub → Settings → **SSH and GPG keys**.
  Docs: [https://docs.github.com/authentication/connecting-to-github-with-ssh](https://docs.github.com/authentication/connecting-to-github-with-ssh)

---

## Website didn’t update on GitHub Pages

**Using GitHub Actions (recommended):**

* Check **Actions → Quarto Pages**: it should render, upload the artifact, and deploy.
* Repo **Settings → Pages**: set **Source = GitHub Actions**.

**Using branch deployment (`/docs`):**

* Build locally to `docs/` and commit.
* Repo **Settings → Pages**: set **Source = main /docs**.

## Quick diagnostic block (paste into your Console/Terminal)

```r
# R session info
sessionInfo()

# Package + environment checks
library(mccoursepack)
mccourse_self_test()

# Quarto + Git + LaTeX checks
system("quarto --version")
system("git --version")
if (requireNamespace("tinytex", quietly = TRUE)) tinytex::is_tinytex()
```

When asking for help, include the output above, your OS, R, and RStudio versions, and the exact error message.
